* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/05/20, button, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Refine 8812A AMPDU density

* TEST METHOD:
-

* ROOT CAUSE:

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Modify AMPDU density from 8us to 16us to improve
  uplink throughput with ASUS RT-AC87U(AC2400)

------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/05/13, Ken.Chuang, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Modify SWQ mechanism for Netgear A6200 on WQC internal Rx test

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot Rx Throughput test with Netgear A6200

* ROOT CAUSE:
- SWQ mechanism(disabled) leads to Rx throughput degradation with A6200 station
- Add Rx TP checking to enable swq for A6200 but not influence AC68 (AC68 Rx : 460, A6200 Rx : 240)

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- caused by SD8 branch3.4 r32287 (disable swq for AC68 station Rx test)
- confirm this modification with SD8 lihdse
- https://jira.realtek.com/browse/WQCAP-142

------------------------------------------------------------------

  and MP verification by RF Casper

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/04/28, jimmyiln, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Add workaround for client mode roaming

* TEST METHOD:
- Set 8812AR as repeater mode and connect vxd to an AP
- Check if roaming happen or not

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Still unknown

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd.h
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Check if beacon missing happens. If so, send probe request and
  Add-BA to AP to check AP is existing or not. If so, don't do
  roam.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/04/27, erqing_fang, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix the following bug:
- when remote AP is WPA mixed mode, DUT cannot connect to remote AP if set desired bssid

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. remote AP set to WPA mixed mode
- 2. DUT as client or repeater
- 3. connect to remote AP successfully
- 4. set SSID="" and desired bssid as remote AP's bssid
- 5. DUT cannot connect to remote AP

* ROOT CAUSE:
- in this case, DUT does not choose cipher according to remote AP 

* MODIFIED FILES 
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/04/20, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix WQCAP-597 ([AP][RTL8198C+RTL8814AR+RTL8194AR][SDK3.4.9.4] During Connect/Disconnect Test, 2.4G happened TX hang and wireless clients cannot connect to 2.4G anymore.)

* TEST METHOD:
- Refer to WQCAP-597

* ROOT CAUSE:
- BB AD converter or RF hang

* MODIFIED FILES

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to do hangup reset when WQCAP-597 issue happens. I have called BB/RF/Designer to help, but no solution can be found.
  Finally, use hangup to avoid 2.4G cannot be connected anymore. When this issue happens, the path of CCK CCA cannot CCA anymore.
  Use 0xf08 to check CCA counters, CCA_CCK = 0 and CCA_OFDM != 0 and change CCA_CCK (0xa07) to path C then CCA_CCK != 0.
  So, we found only pathB (default CCK CCA path) hang.

------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/04/15, tesia_gao, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Solve the hang issue of 97F during site survey when repeater mode.

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. DUT is repeater mode, when doing simple config (DUT receive all the profile and try to connect remote ap), system will hang.
- 2. when simple config done and DUT is removed, system will hang when vxd site survey.(set remote ap channel 1, and system w  ill hang easily.) 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- channel is 1 but offset is HT_2NDCH_OFFSET_BELOW will result in unsigned int val -1. And system will enter "for loop" fo lo  ng long time and can do nothing. 
- for question 1: if the remote ap offset is HT_2NDCH_OFFSET_BELOW, then the site_survey channel to switch should not start f rom available[0]. 
- for question 2: if DUT root ap RF channel and offset does not match, then the offset should be modified depends on the root ap channel.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:

------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/04/15, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Fix 8194 RX throughput issue with Asus AC68

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 8194 cannot receive final segment of AMPDU (> 32). 

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8812_vht_gen.c
M    8192cd_sme.c 

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch fixes 8194 RX throughput issue with Asus AC68. This is beacuse 8194 cannot receive final segment of AMPDU (> 32).
  To avoid this issue, 8194 in 20M issues addba rsp with buffer size = 32 and disables AMSDU.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/04/06, charliecheng, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 8881A/8812AR-VN power limit and power by rate setting when operating 2.4G+5G client mode.

* TEST METHOD:
- Check mib_rf after connect to 2.4G/5GHz AP.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- For dual band supported wireless ICs, (eg, 8881A/8812AR-VN), configure as a 2.4GHz 
  client and connect to 5GHz AP. After client connected to AP, it will use wrong power limit and power by rate table which is used for 2.4G.


* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd.h
- 8192cd_hw.c

------------------------------------------------------------------
* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/03/16, Ken Chuang, Bug Fixed

* DIGEST:
- 8685P+8812AE with 8812AU Tx throughput test issue with Register 0x420 setting
- Refer to https://jira.realtek.com/browse/WQCAP-142
- Register 0x420(0x80) will let Tx throughput become lower. 
- Roll back register 0x420 from 0x80 to 0x0 for DSL platform (8685P+8812AE)

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot Tx throughput test with 3 pair high_performance scrip file

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Refer to SD8 Jungle R32548 modification.
- R32548:
  Roll back register 0x420 from 0x0 to 0x80 (avoid cable link unstablity)
  Set 0x420 = 0x0 will gain TX performance in short distance, 
  But may cause Downlink Traffic fail in long distance test of Cable link. 

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_hw.c

------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/03/16, erqing_fang, code refine

* DIGEST:

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/03/08, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- No execute bws mechanism when the existence of VHT STA association.

* TEST METHOD:
- 8814 v.s. MACBOOK. In first step, 8814 is in CH149 and MACBOOK connect to 8814. In second step, switch 8814 from CH149 to CH36 and MACBOOK auto connects to 8814ar.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- MACBOOK sends operating mode ie and indiciates 40M bandwidth. But MACBOOK sends 80M packets to 8814ar. In 8814, bws mechanism switchs BW to 40M. It cause poor UL throughput

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_util.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 8814 v.s. MACBOOK. In first step, 8814 is in CH149 and MACBOOK connect to 8814. In second step, switch 8814 from CH149 to CH36
  and MACBOOK auto connects to 8814ar. MACBOOK sends operating mode ie and indiciates 40M bandwidth. 
  But MACBOOK sends 80M packets to 8814ar. In 8814, bws mechanism switchs BW to 40M. 
  It causes poor UL throughputMACBOOK sends operating mode ie and indiciates 40M bandwidth. 
  But MACBOOK sends 80M packets to 8814ar. In 8814, bws mechanism switchs BW to 40M. It cause poor UL throughput.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/03/03, button, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Refine max aggregation number under multi-station test

* TEST METHOD:
- Test by SG team

* ROOT CAUSE:

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- When doing multi-STA test (STA number more than 10)
  Max aggregation number in 2.4G: 8
  Max aggregation number in 5G: 16

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/03/02, Ken Chuang, Bug Fixed

* DIGEST:
- 88E + Netgear AC6200 Rx throughput test fail
- Refer to https://jira.realtek.com/browse/WQCAP-585

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot Rx throughput test with 3 pair high_performance scrip file
- AC6200 driver version : 6.30.61.21

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Refer to SD8 Jungle R28627 modification.
- Caused by Changing 88E Rx AMPDU size from 64 to 16. (issue_ADDBArsp, Buffer Size param)
- The aggregation number of packets sent from AC6200 to AP will be small to 16 sometimes.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_sme.c

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:

* DIGEST:

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/02/26, Peter Yu, Bug Fixed

* DIGEST:
- Sometimes, system will hang when open wlan interface

* TEST METHOD:
- reboot the system or wlan interface down/up

* ROOT CAUSE:
- In the process of parsing "power tracking table", the "get_digit_tracking" function 
  can't distinguish the end of file. So, it would not break the while loop and let system hang.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/02/17, scko, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- For some AP, we can't complete the 4-way handshake during the connection in our client mode.
- The 3rd step always says 'Check MIC Error'.

* TEST METHOD:
-

* ROOT CAUSE:
- For some AP/STA, it will send EAPOL KEY frame that packet body not match with the body length in
EAPOL Key header. We should use the length field in EAPOL header instead of the total received packet length
to calculate the MIC.
 Note: be sure endian transformation.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/02/17, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Add mib "sub_pwr" to reduce more power when hp mechanism is triggered for 8194.

* TEST METHOD:
- throughput test of 8194 v.s. Intel chip 7260

* ROOT CAUSE:
- High tx power causes bad throughput with Intel chip. minus 11db is not enough so add sub_pwr
  function to subtract more tx power.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_hw.c
M    8192cd.h
M    8192cd_ioctl.c
M    HalDMOutSrc.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Add mib "sub_pwr" to reduce more power when hp mechanism is triggered for 8814. This patch is because
  High tx power causes bad throughput with Intel chip. minus 11db is not enough so add sub_pwr
  function to subtract more tx power. This patch only for 8194 and sub_pwr sub TX power for total STA so
  only RSSI_min (rssi of the farthest STA) > threshold is triggered.

* DIGEST:

- 2. Fixed a crash issue when one entry in mib_all is greater than a page.

* TEST METHOD:
- cat /proc/wlan0/mib_all

- system crash.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2016/01/05, erqing_fang, bug fix

* DIGEST:
 single-eth-client cannot work if ACL function is enabled

* TEST METHOD:
	-LANPC2 --- AP2(Client) --- APUT1 --- LANPC1 
	-1.APUT1 enable ACL function 
	-2.input case 1 : LANPC2' mac to the allow table 
		or case 2:Client's mac to the deny table 
	-3.client device(AP2) enable single eth-client and then connect to the APUT by the site survey menu 
	-Result: 
	-case1:LANPC2 can't connect to DUT.(ping LANPC1 fail) 
	-case2:LANPC2 can't connect to DUT.(ping LANPC1 fail) 

	-Expect reseult: 
	-case1:APUT1 should allow LANPC2 mac. 
	-case2:APUT1 should deny Client's mac, allow LANPC2 with single eth-clientt

* ROOT CAUSE:
-client has no chance to study LanPC's mac if client don't associate APUT

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-https://jira.realtek.com/browse/WQCAP-325
-https://jira.realtek.com/browse/WQCAP-361

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/12/25, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Rx Reorder timeout issue when testing repeater mode.

* TEST METHOD:
- Repeater mode, client is R7000 client, repeater is 8814 5G, remote AP is 8814 5G AP.
  UL throughput test, if using Chariot throughput script, throughput usually drops close to 0Mbps.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Root cause is when rx packets are lost continously, ex. SN 1,2,3,4,5 packets are lost and SN6 is received.
  When rx reorder timeout (ex. 30ms) is triggered, only SN1 is timeout. SN2~5 restarts to wait timeout.
  So SN6 transmit to upper layer after 150ms (30ms x 5).

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_rx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to modify Rx Reorder timeout method when testing repeater mode. This issue is repeater UL test.
  Repeater mode, client is R7000 client, repeater is 8814 5G, remote AP is 8814 5G AP.
  UL throughput test, if using Chariot throughput script, throughput usually drops close to 0Mbps.
  Root cause is when rx packets are lost continously, ex. SN 1,2,3,4,5 packets are lost and SN6 is received.
  When rx reorder timeout (ex. 30ms) is triggered, only SN1 is timeout. SN2~5 restarts to wait timeout.
  So SN6 transmit to upper layer after 150ms (30ms x 5).
  This patch modify rx reorder do SN1~5 timeout continouely. So SN1~5 only costs 30ms, then SN6 packet is transmitted.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/11/30, YangQuan, Bug fix

* DIGEST:
- bug fix for vxd connect to previous AP after change vxd SSID by iwpriv command

* TEST METHOD:
1. vxd connect to remote AP SSID1 and verify connect successful
2. run command on console:ifconfig wlan1-vxd down; iwpriv wlan1-vxd set_mib ssid=SSID2; ifconfig wlan1-vxd up; cat /proc/wlan1-vxd/mib_staconfig
3. the SSID2 is not exist in test environment. before modify, the mib_staconfig value of dot11DesiredSSID will be changed to SSID1 after a while and connect to SSID1 successful sometimes.
4. after modify, the vxd won't connect to remote AP SSID1 when use iwpriv to set ssid as SSID2.
5. verify the vxd can connect successful when set the SSID to SSID1 again. verify the root AP's ssid related info is not changed after vxd SSID modification

* ROOT CAUSE:
- it don't clear the dot11Bss in start_clnt_lookup for vxd client before modify, start_clnt_auth will set dot11DesiredSSID to dot11Bss.ssid and will connect to previous AP.

* MODIFIED FILES
-  8192cd_sme.c
-  8192cd_ioctl.c

* DESCRIPTION:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/11/25, Jeng-Wei LEE, new feature

* DIGEST:
- Add Beamforming_Auto mechanism

* TEST METHOD:
- cable link test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- For FCC logo test, enabling TXBF leads to smaller tx power than disabling TXBF. So, to avoid lower throughput,
  the beamforming_auto mechanism is used.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_headers.h
M    8192cd_proc.c
M    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/RTL8814A/Hal8814ADef.h
M    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/RTL8814A/Hal8814AGen.c
M    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/Hal88XXGen.c
AM   WlanHAL/Data/8814A/TXPWR_LMT_8814Amp_TXBF.txt
M    WlanHAL/HalDef.h
M    8192cd_hw.c
M    change.txt
M    8192cd_cfg.h
M    8192cd_ioctl.c
M    8192cd.h
M    Beamforming.c


* DESCRIPTION:
- To avoid lower throughput when enabling TXBF compared to non-TXBF case, beamforming_auto mechanism uses two Power Limit tables, 
  normal and TXBF. In channel x, check the difference of power limit in normal and TXBF Power Limit tables. When the difference is
  bigger than 2db, beamforming_auto mechanism avoids adding STA to TXBFee entry.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
- 2015/11/16, Peter Yu, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix core dump on OSK platform when the interface close/open in many times

* TEST METHOD:
- Use one station to connect and test throughput
- close and open interface in many times

* ROOT CAUSE:
- "priv->pshare->highTP_found_pstatnd_pstat" is not clear when interface closed, 
  but station info will be free in interface down.
- When interface open, it will do iot_engine and use "priv->pshare->highTP_found_pstatnd_pstat".
- It will let system crash

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_cd.h

* DESCRIPTION:
-
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/11/16, Andrew, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fixwlan monitor mode enable fail

* TEST METHOD:
-  

* ROOT CAUSE:
- ioctl_copy_from_user/ioctl_copy_to_user are declared static in 8192cd_ioctl.c 
   but these fuctions are used in 8192cd_comapi.c when enabled monitor mode.
   It causes compile error.

* MODIFIED FILES
 - Makefile
 - 8192cd_header.h
 - 8192cd_ictol.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Move ioctl_copy_from_user/ioctl_copy_to_user to 8192cd_header.h

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/11/05, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Remove aggregation number=4 when 1SS/2SS MCS0~MCS2 tx rates are used.

* TEST METHOD:
- Cable link test compared with tags 3.4.9.3 in 98C+8814+8194

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Low aggregation number lead to throughput drop.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is for 5G 80M cable link DL test. 
  Remove aggregation number=4 when 1SS/2SS MCS0~MCS2 tx rates are used, so aggregation number is 0x3c for 8814 in 5G.

- 2015/11/04, Brian, bug fix (for OpenWRT)

* DIGEST:
- Core dump happen while activate AP with DFS channel secound time

* TEST METHOD:
- Setup AP with DFS channel then wait CAC finished
- Configure AP to another DFS channel.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/11/02, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Fine tune 8814/8194 2nd CCA threshold and TRX mode threshold

* TEST METHOD:
- cable link throughput test 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- In 97db decade, 3.4.9.4 throughput is worse than 3.4.9.3 throughput.
  Two reason, one is CCA threshold, the other is TRX mode threshold.
  When RX mode, TXOP is disabled so that throughput is bad.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/RTL8814A/Hal8814APhyCfg.c
M    EdcaTurboCheck.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch finetune 2ndCCA threshold and TRX mode threshold.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/29, erqing_fang,bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix:After repeater WPS, root interface func_off will be set to 1 

* TEST METHOD:
  96E+92E,enable CONFIG_REPEATER_WPS_SUPPORT,start WPS on repeater interface, when WPS done, root interface's SSID cannot be scaned, check mib func_off=1

* ROOT CAUSE:
  when doing wps in repeater mode, root interface func_off will be set to 1 in start_clnt_ss() and set back to 0 in rtl8192cd_ss_timer(), but in repeater mode, rtl8192cd_ss_timer() cannot set it back to 0.
* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-JIRA:https://jira.realtek.com/browse/APROUTER-214

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/21, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fixed

* DIGEST:
- Refine the position of spread spectrum to avoid system hang issue

* TEST METHOD:
- over night reboot test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Wrong position of spread spectrum leads to system hang

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_hw.c
M    8192cd_osdep.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Original position of spread spectrum is after phy calibrate in rtl8192cd_init_hw_PCI.
spread spectrum may lead to PCIE hang when PCIE interface is working. So do spread spectrum after Wlan_HAL_Link in
rtl8192cd_init_one

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/20, Family, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix connection issue when reach max STA connection number and expired STA exist

* TEST METHOD:
- Establish maximum supported STA connections in one interface of APUT
- Let one or more STA leave in basic set area
- If one STA's expire time count down to 0, then use new STA to connect another
  interface of APUT, but new STA can't connect to APUT

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Expired STA check in alloc_stainfo only for one interface, not all interface

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_util.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/19, wishchen, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Enable RTS/CTS by default

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot throughput test in Shielding Room

* ROOT CAUSE:
- RTS/CTS better than CTS-to-SELF to prevent collision

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Enable RTS/CTS by default. (Originally check rssi to decide to use RTS/CTS or CTS-to-SELF)
  8881AB/92E 1Mbps degradation for downlink compared with CTS-To-Self

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/19, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Enable WIFI_MIN_IMEM_USAGE flags to improve WLAN -> WAN performance in 96e+92e platform

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot throughput test in Shielding Room 

* ROOT CAUSE:

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_cfg.h

* DESCRIPTION:
- This is from JIRA issue (APROUTER-230). Root cause is cache miss issue. Enable WIFI_MIN_IMEM_USAGE flag from SD9 Annie.
  The performance can improve to 92Mbps.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/06, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 8814 beacon error issue when vap + root interfaces are enabled 

* TEST METHOD:
- In Openwrt 2.4, turn on root + vap interfaces. Check stats info beacon counter.
  or in SDK 3.4.9.3, turn on root + vap interfaces and down up vap interfaces. Check stats info beacon counter. 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Wrong REG_MBSSID_BCN_SPACE, REG_MBSSID_BCN_SPACE3 and REG_DRVERLYINT setting. 
 (these register positions in 8814 are different from other chips.)

* MODIFIED FILES
M    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/Hal88XXGen.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to Fix 8814 beacon error issue when vap + root interfaces are enabled.
  In Openwrt 2.4, turn on root + vap interfaces. Check stats info beacon counter.
  or in SDK 3.4.9.3, turn on root + vap interfaces and down up vap interfaces. Check stats info beacon counter.
  Root cause is that wrong REG_MBSSID_BCN_SPACE, REG_MBSSID_BCN_SPACE3 and REG_DRVERLYINT setting.
 (these register positions in 8814 are different from other chips.)
  Modify the codes for correct setting to solve this issue.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/09/11, scko, Sync patch

* DIGEST:
- When tx2path enable, beacon power is unstable.

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- The tx phase of the two path will be different after every time of TRX. It results add or subtraction.
If we don't close TX IQGen in RX mode to keep the phase stable. The power measured in combining splitter will be stable.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_hw.c
- 8192cd_mp.c
- 8812_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/02, scko, Sync patch

* DIGEST:
- Only update rssi_min after 4way handshake

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. Connect a STA in near field.
- 2. Use another in far field and use wrong password to connect
- 3. To observe the DIG variation.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- When STA is connected and proceed to do 4way handshake, we should not consider its rssi into rssi_min
- calculation because it might affect the result if it can't pass 4way finally.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/02, wishchen, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Copy 8814/8194 path A RCK result to path B/C/D

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- path B/C/D RCK don't work since IC bug bug path A RCK is OK.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- During Radio PHY parameter setting, RF 0x1c and 0x1f are set for RCK.
  After, copy path A RCK result 0x1c to path B/C/D 0x1c

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/10/02, scko, Sync patch

* DIGEST:
- Fix a issue of adjustment of RRSR (response rate set register).

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- When high power mechanism is triggered, the TX power of date will be decreased in filling TX descriptor.
Also, if all station's RSSI is greater than threshold(current is 73), the code will try to modify RRSR to decrease
ACK rate. However, the ACK rate should be controlled by another register (0x6d8), not immediately modify the
RF index. Doing so will decrease the power of data by twice, which is not acceptable.

* MODIFIED FILES
- HalDMOutSrc.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/9/22, skylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- fix src mac in ADDBA-req may be incorrect under multi-sta repeater mode

* TEST METHOD:
1. Configure to Musti-STA Repeater mode.
2. Connect Repeater to AP.
3. Connect Station to Repeater.
4. Run IxChariot for throughput test: LAN -> AP -> Repeater -> Station
5. Use sniffer to check packets between repeater and station.
6. Observe that packets to station are not aggregated.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- ACTIVE_ID should be set to 0 for AP interface. Otherwise, source mac address
  in ADDBA-req would be replaced to mac-clone address by mistake and STATION
  will not reply to the request.    

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- bug fix for MULTI_MAC_CLONE

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/09/21, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Refine 8814 2ndCCA related parameters and defaultly turn on 2ndCCA (add miss part).

* TEST METHOD:
- This patch is for repeater vxd disconnect issue.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- When 2ndCCA is disabled, 80M RX CCA is used. But 8814 HW may detect CCA fail.
  This fail may cause no beacon received in vxd interface and vxd disconnect remote ap.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/RTL8814A/Hal8814APhyCfg.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to refine 8814 2ndCCA related parameters and defaultly turn on 2ndCCA.
  Turn off 2ndCCA may cause 8814 HW detects CCA fail. and this fail may cause no
  beacon received in vxd interface and vxd disconnect remote ap. So in default, enable 8814 2ndCCA.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/09/01, button, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 92e STA expiration issue

* TEST METHOD:
- Test by Brian at ifenglian

* ROOT CAUSE:
- FW count broadcast packets to unicast by mistake

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Don't count tx status of high queue, mgt queue
- 8812, 8192e, 8881a, 8814, 8194 are checked

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/08/25, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Set TXPowerOffset based on minimum power index for hp mechanism to avoid negative power index.

* TEST METHOD:
- throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- When hp mechanism is triggered, tx power is minus 7/11dB by txdesc TXPowerOffset=2/3.
  However, the minimum power index is smaller than 14/22 so that power index becomes to negative value.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_proc.c
M    8192cd_tx.c
M    8192cd_hw.c
M    8192cd_hw.h

* DESCRIPTION:
- When hp mechanism is triggered, tx power is minus 7/11dB by txdesc TXPowerOffset=2/3.
  However, the minimum power index is smaller than 22 so that power index becomes to negative value.
  So, this patch set TXPowerOffset based on rfetype and minimum power index for hp mechanism to avoid negative power index.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/08/20, button, new feature

* DIGEST:
- Add MIB to increase Tx power of beacon and probersp 

* TEST METHOD:
- Verify by IQ nxn

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 

* MODIFIED FILES
- WlanHAL/RTL88XX/Hal88XXPhyCfg.c
- WlanHAL/RTL88XX/Hal88XXTxDesc.c

- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- 8192cd.h

* DESCRIPTION:

- MIB bcnagc 0: default setting
- MIB bcnagc 1: increase beacon power 3dB
- MIB bcnagc 2: increase beacon power 6dB    
- MIB bcn_pwr_max: Maximum power index of beacon (please set before wlan open)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/07/29, scko, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Under multi-sta repeter mode, ethernet PC can't be deleted after expiration time.

* TEST METHOD:
- Setup multi-sta repeater which will connect to remote-ap
- Setup another remote-ap.
- Plug in ethernet cable to repeater, and servey some website to make some traffic.
- Unplug the ethernet cable
- Wait for 5 minutes to expire.
- Check the sta_info in remote-ap.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Under multi-sta repeater mode, when ethernet PC is unpluged and wait the remote AP to expire the information
  of the PC. Remote AP will send de-auth packet to repeater and try to delete the STA entry.
  But the repeater connection will aggressively re-connects to remote AP. It causes the expiration time to be
  re-counted and the station info still exists.
  To make it sense, we check the station type after receive de-auth packet. If it is a ethernet station, don't 
  re-connect so aggressively.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/07/28, button, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix client mode disconnect after remote AP group key rekeying

* TEST METHOD:
- Remote AP: BR6477AC IODATA, RT6856+5392
- Remote AP config to WPA-mixed mode, and shorten rekey time
- DUT associate to remote AP and check connectivity continuously

* ROOT CAUSE:
- After group rekeying, remote AP send broadcast packet without encryption, 
  DUT assume it's a encryption packet, and calculate MIC then disassocate

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_rx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Don't calculate MIC if receiving a plantext packet 
- Decrypt packet by sw if hardware cam entry isn't ready

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/07/15, jimmylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix getting NULL vxd priv in vap interfaces

* TEST METHOD:
-

* ROOT CAUSE:
- When repeater mode is vxd-vap, sometimes it needs to get vxd priv to do
  something. The original GET_VXD_PRIV() will get NULL vxd priv because
  vxd priv only exists in pvxd_priv of root interface.
- Modify GET_VXD_PRIV() to get root priv first to fix this issue.

- EdcaTurboCheck.c

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/07/06, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Set 8814 TXPowerOffset based on rfetype and minimum power index for hp mechanism to avoid negative power index.
  (Add missing cases)

* TEST METHOD:
- throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- In 3.4.9.3 8814 band1, only 3SS MCS5 TX rate is used when hp mechanism is triggered.
  When hp mechanism is triggered, tx power is minus 11dB by txdesc TXPowerOffset=3.
  However, the minimum power index is smaller than 22 so that power index becomes to negative value.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_hw.c
M    8192cd_hw.h
M    change.txt
M    8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- The issue happens in 3.4.9.3 8814 band1 that only 3SS MCS5 TX rate is used when hp mechanism is triggered.
  When hp mechanism is triggered, tx power is minus 11dB by txdesc TXPowerOffset=3.
  However, the minimum power index is smaller than 22 so that power index becomes to negative value.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/07/02, jimmylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix station under vap0 can not enter bridge shortcut

* TEST METHOD:
-

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Because interfaces are divided to two groups for multiple repeater function,
  vxd can only enter bridge shortcut with wlan0 and vap1. vap0 and vap2 are in
  the same group, but not the same with vxd, therefore vap0 can not enter bridge
  shortcut when repeater mode is vxd <-> vap0.
- The way to fix it is we don't check group when multiple repeater function is
  not enabled.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_osdep.c
- 8192cd_rx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/06/24, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Set 8814 TXPowerOffset based on rfetype and minimum power index for hp mechanism to avoid negative power index.

* TEST METHOD:
- throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- In 3.4.9.3 8814 band1, only 3SS MCS5 TX rate is used when hp mechanism is triggered.
  When hp mechanism is triggered, tx power is minus 11dB by txdesc TXPowerOffset=3.
  However, the minimum power index is smaller than 22 so that power index becomes to negative value.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_hw.c
M    8192cd_hw.h
M    change.txt
M    8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- The issue happens in 3.4.9.3 8814 band1 that only 3SS MCS5 TX rate is used when hp mechanism is triggered.
  When hp mechanism is triggered, tx power is minus 11dB by txdesc TXPowerOffset=3.
  However, the minimum power index is smaller than 22 so that power index becomes to negative value.
  So, this patch set 8814 TXPowerOffset based on rfetype and minimum power index for hp mechanism to avoid negative power index.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/06/23, EricYeh, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Roll back register 0x420 from 0x0 to 0x80 (avoid cable link unstablity)

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Set 0x420 = 0x0 will gain TX performance in short distance, 
  But may cause Downlink Traffic fail in long distance test of Cable link.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/06/23, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- use cts2self when rssi > rts_rssith+5 and use rts when rssi < rts_rssith 

* TEST METHOD:
- throughput test in Shielding Room and Field trial

* ROOT CAUSE:
- In shielding room, for 8814 AP, throughput with cts2self has 20Mbps more than that with RTS.
  In 6F Field Trial(In P7), for 8194AP, no RTS will cause collision with MI and AC68, even cts2self is used.

* MODIFIED FILES
M    8192cd_proc.c
M    8192cd_ioctl.c
M    8192cd_tx.c
M    8192cd.h
M    8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch modifies RTS mechanism, use cts2self when rssi > rts_rssith+5 and use rts when rssi < rts_rssith.
  This patch is to improve throughput in sheidling room and 6F Field trial.
  In shielding room, for 8814 AP, throughput with cts2self has 20Mbps more than that with RTS.
  In 6F Field Trial(In P7), for 8194AP, no RTS will cause collision with MI and AC68, even cts2self is used.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Mistakenly took MCS7/MCS15 target power as bases for VHT-rate. 
  VHT-rate bases should be VTH 1SS MCS7 and VHT 2SS MCS7.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- n/a

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/05/13, Jeng-Wei LEE, new feature

* DIGEST:
- Add 2G Broadcom VHT cap IE parser in OnAssocRsp and OnAssocReq.

* TEST METHOD:
- 8194 is client/AP mode and broadcom R7000 is AP/client mode with 600Mbps rate. 8194 connects to broadcom.
  Make sure that 8194 transmits packets with VHT rate

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Broadcom AP/STA hides VHT cap IE in its properitary IE when 2G supports 600Mbps. 
  So additional vht cap IE parser is needed for Broadcom 2G AC-supported AP.  

* MODIFIED FILES

  So additional vht cap IE parser is needed for Broadcom 2G AC-supported AP.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/04/22, wishchen, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Correct 8812 2G BB swing initial value and eliminate 2G spur.

* TEST METHOD:
- Check BB swing 0xc1c/0xe1c
- Check spur elimination register 0x8ac/0x8c4 
- RF test passed 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- n/a

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_headers.h
- 8192cd_hw.c
- 8812_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Refifne 8812 2G by 
  1. Correct 8812 2G BB swing initial value
  2. 8812 2G spur at 2480MHz. When switching channel or bandwidth, check
     if 2480MHz is covered, i.e. ch13/ch14 for 20M and ch11/ch12 for 40M.
     Set 0x8ac/0x8c4 if spur found. Reset 0x8ac/0x8c4 if spur for pre-channel-bandwidth
	 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/04/22, weikaichuang, bug fixed

* DIGEST:
- Fix under repeater mode, driver send arp response for non-associated STA

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. Set two repeater mode client(DUT) connect to AP and config as dhcp client
  2. RPT1 gets IP first
  3. RPT2 gets IP

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Our driver will send arp response when receiving a dhcp packet.
  The original flow did not check if the da of dhcp offer is an associated STA
  or not. Therefore, RPT1 will receive RPT2's dhcp offer and send an arp
  packet which causes some dhcp servers consider RPT1's dhcp timeout.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_util.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

* DIGEST:
- 1. Support DFS repeater mode for logo test
  2. disable adaptivity by default

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. Set root channel = non-DFS channel
  2. Remote AP in DFS channel
  3. repeater mode vxd should wait CAC timeout to connect remote AP
  4. When repeater is in DFS channel, it must be able to detect radar
  5. use sniffer in remote AP's channel and observe DUT's packets
  6. DUT's packets (include beacon) cannot appear with in CAC period

* MODIFIED FILES:

- 8192cd_dfs_det.c

* DESCRIPTION:

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/4/21, jimmylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Clear WDS bridge shortcut cache when WDS peer leaves

* TEST METHOD:
- Make a WDS connection between 2 APs
- Set these 2 APs the same SSID
- Make a wireless STA connecting to the first WDS AP
- Make a PC connecting to the second WDS AP by ethernet
- Shut down the first WDS AP and let STA roam to the second WDS AP
- Traffic between STA and ethernet PC will be blocked

* ROOT CAUSE:
- WDS bridge shortcut cache is still there and traffic from ethernet will
  be forwarded to the WDS interface, not to the AP interface
- Clear WDS bridge shortcut cache when WDS peer leaves to stop bridge
  shortcut between WDS and ethernet

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8188e_hw.c
- HalDMOutSrc.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/04/20, chuangsw, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Refine checkBandwidth() when enable 20/40 coexist.

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. Set AP1-STA1(intel-6300) in channel 1 (40 MHz).
- 2. Set AP2-STA2(intel-6300) in channel 11 (legacy mode).
- 3. Start chariot with AP2-STA2.
- 4. Start chariot with AP1-STA1, and the chariot will stop after 3 min.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- In checkBandwidth() we will detect FA when enable 20/40 coexist.
- Sometimes the FA is very high to trigger checkBandwidth() switch to 20MHz.
- And when FA is lower the checkBandwidth() will switch to 40MHz.
- After switch to 20MHz/40MHz about 3 times, the intel STA will be abnormal and
  cannot receive any packet from AP.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_util.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/4/10, skylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:

b. fix VAP(client) disconnection problem

* TEST METHOD:

a2. Disconnect STA from Repeater.
a3. Check if corresponding sta_info on remote AP is removed.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Incorrect priv used in __del_mclone_addr(). 
  This issue might cause tx_fails in AP statistics.
- ACTIVE_ID was not set correctly in ResendTimeout().
  VAP might disconnect from remote AP by mistake due to cloned-STA 4-way timeout.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/4/8, ericchen, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 8814 Tx hang and Rx endurance fail issues in non-rtk platform 

* TEST METHOD:
- Use chariot to do endurance testing

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Tx hang issue is caused by agg default number 63 is bigger than hw supported number 56.
  Change it to 48 by setting reg 0x4ca
- Rx endurance fail issue is caused by worng cache sync direction and dynamic rx tasklet mechanism

* MODIFIED FILES
- WlanHAL\RTL88XX\Hal88XXRxDesc.c
- WlanHAL\RTL88XX\Hal88XXTxDesc.c
- 8192cd_hw.c
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/3/24, weikaichuang, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix client mode TSF sync cause RA not functional.

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. Client mode connect to AP in open space
  2. interface down up
  3. start run chariot from client to AP without any ping
  4. observe Tx rate from rssi dump

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Originally, client mode did not check BSSID. Therefore, it will sync APs
  TSF in the air. RA is working base on TBTT (TSF+Bcn interval) interupt.
  Since TSF is mis-sync from other APs. RA will not work normally.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- check BSSID for pure client mode.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/3/24, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix the issue that Non-PMF-sta can't connect to the APUT which security type is capable-enable (capable and SHA256 enable)

* TEST METHOD:
- Use 8812 client in WinXP system to connect AP using PMF capable and SHA256 enabled.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Key Description Type in EAPOL KEY (1/4) is SHA256 for non-SHA256 client.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_psk.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to fix the issue that Non-PMF-sta can't connect to the APUT which security type is capable-enable.
  This patch modifies key description type to 2 for SHA1 client.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/3/17, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix highest tx rate for each SS for 8814 when bandwidth is 20M.

* TEST METHOD:
- Use sniffer to check beacon VHT capability ie.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Spec defines that when bandwidth is 20M, highest rates of 1SS and 2SS are 1SS/2SS MCS8.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8812_vht_gen.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to modify VHT capability ie to support 1SS MCS8 and 2SS MCS8 when bandwidth is 20M.
  1SS MCS9 and 2SS MCS9 is prohibited when bandwidth is 20M.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/3/16, skylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix missing Requested IP Address option in DHCP REQUEST

* TEST METHOD:
1. configure to multi-sta repeater mode
2. connect STA to repeater and obtain IP address via DHCP
3. force STA to new DHCP lease
4. use sniffer to check DHCP REQUEST frame broadcasted by repeater

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Source hardware address is changed prior to dhcp_flag_bcast() and make
  dhcp_add_reqip_option() unreachable.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Bug fix for MULTI_MAC_CLONE

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/3/9, lucy, new feature

* DIGEST:
- Add Band Steering feature
- Fix compiler warning

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_cfg.h
- 8192cd.h
- 8192cd_band_steering.c
- 8192cd_a4_sta.c
- 8192cd_headers.h
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- 8192cd_osdep.c
- 8192cd_proc.c
- 8192cd_sme.c
- 8192cd_util.h
- ieee802_mib.h
- Makefile

* DESCRIPTION:
- Usage: 
    1. #define BAND_STEERING in 8192cd_cfg.h and then build the image
    2. enable band steering feature:
           ifconfig wlan0 down
           ifconfig wlan1 down
           iwpriv wlan0 set_mib bs_enable=1   (enable band steering)
           iwpriv wlan1 set_mib bs_enable=1   (enable band steering)  
           iwpriv wlan0 set_mib bs_prefer_band=0  (set the prefer band to wlan0)
           iwpriv wlan1 set_mib bs_prefer_band=0  (set the prefer band to wlan0)     
           ifconfig wlan0 up
           ifconfig wlan1 up 
    3. disable band steering feature:
           ifconfig wlan0 down
           ifconfig wlan1 down
           iwpriv wlan0 set_mib bs_enable=0   (disable band steering)
           iwpriv wlan1 set_mib bs_enable=0   (disable band steering)   
           ifconfig wlan0 up
           ifconfig wlan1 up
    4. To modify parameters of band steering, please set following mibs for both bands. 
           "bs_param_1":  rssi thredshold T (default value is 40)
           "bs_param_2":  rssi thredshold tolerance W (default value is 5)        
           "bs_param_3":  X period (default value is 300, in unit of second) 
           "bs_param_4":  Y retries (default value is 3)  
           "bs_param_5":  Z period (default value is 20)

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/3/9, wishchen, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 8814 MP SW Tx hang after executing 8814 MP HW Tx 

* TEST METHOD:
- Execute 8814 MP SW Tx after executing HW Tx.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- BB register settings were missed. Register to turn on true MAC was not set.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_mp.c
- 8192cd_headers.h

* DESCRIPTION:
- After executing 8814 MP HW Tx(pseudo MAC), Tx hang will occur if executing 8814 MP SW Tx(true MAC). 
  Correct BB register settings, turning on true MAC,  before SW Tx is executed.

- Fix DHCP Client Hardware Address is not replaced on shortcut path

* TEST METHOD:
1. iwpriv wlan0-va1 set_mib dhcp_bcst_disable=1
   *because DHCP server might not response to REQUEST with broadcast flag set
2. use 'ipconfig /renew' on PC to issue DHCP REQUEST
3. sniff DHCP conversation on PC with Wireshark and check DHCP ACK payload

* ROOT CAUSE:
- mclone_dhcp_caddr() is not executed at shortcut path

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_br_ext.c
- 8192cd_rx.h

* DESCRIPTION:
- Bug fix for MULTI_MAC_CLONE

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/02/06, EricYeh, Bug Fix

* DIGEST:
- Add reset_FA_reg support for 8881A 8812 8814

* TEST METHOD:
- When doing Auto Channel Selection, 
  False Alarm value of fisrt available channel is much higher than others.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Becaue these WiFi ICs NOT implement reset FA API, 
  first available channel will accumulate FA values for longer period.

* MODIFIED FILES
- HalDMOutSrc.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Add reset_FA_reg support for 8881A 8812 8814

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/2/5, Brian, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- For dual band supported wireless ICs, (eg, 8881A), configure as a 2.4GHz 
  client and connect to 5GHz AP. After client connected to AP, it will roaming
  repeatedly.

* TEST METHOD:
- 1.Config root as client mode at 2.4GHz
    (set flash MIB band to 79, channel to 11)
- 2.Sitesurvey from web UI and onnect to a 5GHz AP
- 3.Make sure remote 5GHz AP is not flooding any traffic to client.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Configure as 2.4GHz initially make phyBandSelect as PHY_BAND_2G(1).
  phyBandSelect is refered at OnBeaconClnt_Bss. And under PHY_BAND_2G,
  rxBeaconNumInPeriod will be increased only _DSSET_IE_ is available.
  But 5GHz AP is not carrying this IE. Then client will trigger roaming
  by Beacon lost and not receiving any data from AP.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Block set phyBandSelect from set_mib as well.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/2/4, weikaichuang, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix rootAP(+ VAP enabled) cannot connect after root client mode is connected
  with remote AP

* TEST METHOD:
- 1.config root as client mode
  2.connect to remote AP
  3.in web UI config as root AP + VAP
  4.use STA connect to root AP

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Once root client mode is associated with remote AP, vxd bssid will be set as
  wlan0 mac addr by enable_vxd_ap. This will cause
  rtl8192cd_rx_dispatch_mgmt_adhoc( )drop auth and associate request from STA.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_rx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- n/a

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/01/22, Brian, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Bridge is not able to get IP from remote DHCP server when client mode under
  WEP secured 

* TEST METHOD:
- Setup client mode to connet some AP under WEP secured
- Config bridge to be a DHCP client
- When system re-initialized, bridge keep IP address in flash (by default)
  instead of IP address from remote AP 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- For scenario that all secutiry CAMs are occupied for stations, it is not
  required to consider condition that enable hardware support for WEP default key

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/1/14, scko, add feature

* DIGEST:
- Add support for preventing ARP spoofing attack

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. Connect STA1 to DUT
- 2. Connect STA2 to DUT
- 3. From STA2, use omnipeek to send ARP packet with SrcIP set to bridge IP of DUT to STA1
- 4. The packet should be drop by checking stats

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Whether ARP request or response, the spoofing packet would set bridge IP of gateway to Source IP field of ARP, drop this kind of packet.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_cfg.h
- 8192cd_rx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/1/14, skylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix duplicated mac-clone entry caused by send_arp_response()

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. Setup multi-STA repeater (enable MULTI_MAC_CLONE)
  2. Use wifi STA to connect to repeater and execute DHCP
  3. Check /proc/wlan0/msta_info if wifi STA takes two entries

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Set skb->cb[40] to 0x86518192 to mark as wifi packet. Otherwise, this ARP response
  will be handled as ethernet packet and create a new mac-clone entry.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_util.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/01/13, lucy, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix A4_STA issue: after A4_STA client is expired the ping from AP to A4_STA client fail

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- The TX is disabled after A4_STA client is expired, 
  therefore all the packets including both mcast(would be transform to unicast) and unicast cannot be sent to A4_STA client.
  Non-A4_STA client do not has this problem because the mcast packet can still be trasmitted.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Do not disable TX in A4_STA case.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/01/12, scko, code refine

* DIGEST:
- Refine non-SMP/SMP lock mechanism

* TEST METHOD:
- n/a

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Originally, the tmpbuf1 used to store copied data is a static buffer. Under SMP,
- the lock is needed to be unlocked because of paging system. However, two copy_from_user
- may interleave and corrupt the static buffer. So we refined the lock mechanism. 

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd.h
- 8192cd_comapi.c
- 8192cd_headers.h
- 8192cd_ioctl.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- n/a

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

- This patch is to modify VHT ie to support different TXBF capability for 8814 xTxR mode.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/1/7, skylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix secondary repeater connection fail problem if primary repeater is not associated

* TEST METHOD:
- primary repeater: wlan0 + wlan0-va1(STATION)
  secondary repeater: wlan0-va0 + wlan0-va2(STATION)
- Configure wlan0-va2 to connect to remote AP while wlan0-va1 is unassociated.
  wlan0-va2 will always fail to be associated.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- start_repeater_ss() always use the first unassociated vap interface to scan.
  If wlan0-va1 is configured to connect an offline AP, wlan0-va2 will always fail
  to be associated too.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2015/1/7, skylin, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix vap(station mode) dhcp fail on little-endian platform

* TEST METHOD:
- Do dhcp for vxd/vap(station mode) on x86 platform and check dhcp result.
  Before modified, there is always no DHCP OFFER received.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Incorrect endian for parameter of csum_tcpudp_magic() and lead to UDP checksum error.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_br_ext.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/12/24, EricYeh, New Feature

* DIGEST:
- Implement dynamic CAM SWAP mechanism

* TEST METHOD:
- If station numbers more than HW CAM entries, 
  some stations use SW Encrypt & cost CPU resources, 
  so, if there are idle stations in HW CAM & busy stations use SW Encrypt, 
  remove idle station from HW CAM entry & use SW Encrypt, 
  move busy station use SW Encrypt to HW CAM entry.
   

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd.h
- 8192cd_cfg.h
- 8192cd_headers.h
- 8192cd_hw.c
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- 8192cd_proc.c
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Check the traffic level of all stations & Swap them if condition matched periodically.
  (Period: priv->pshare->rf_ft_var.cam_rotation)
- Swap these stations 
  STA_TRAFFIC_IDLE stations occupied HW CAM entries
  STA_TRAFFIC_HIGH stations use SW ENCRYPT
  
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/12/15, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Fix the issue that 5G 11ac client (ex. samsung S4) cannot connect to 5G AP when 5G 11n client (ex. Intel 5300) connects to 5G AP first.

* TEST METHOD:
- step1: Let 5G 11n client (ex. intel 5300) connect to 5G AP (ex. 8814AR AP)
  step2: Let samsung 5G AC client (ex. samsung S4) connect to 5G AP.
  step3: check whether samsung 5G AC client could connect to 5G AP.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- bws mechanism switch channel bandwidth from 80M to 40M when 5G 11n client is connected.
  channel center segment in VHT Operation IE of beacon or probe rsp is wrong. The correct channel center should be the same as
  80M channel center in bws mechanism.

* MODIFIED FILES:
M    8812_vht_gen.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to fix the issue that 5G 11ac client (ex. samsung S4) cannot connect to 5G AP when 5G 11n client (ex. Intel 5300)
  connects to 5G AP first. Root cause is bws mechanism switch channel bandwidth from 80M to 40M when 5G 11n client is connected.
  channel center segment in VHT Operation IE of beacon or probe rsp is wrong. The correct channel center should be the same as
  80M channel center in bws mechanism.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/12/11, lucy, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix ping fail after STA roaming between AP and Repeater(A4_STA) 

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- The STA disconnect from the remote AP abnormal (without issuing disassociate frame)
  Therefore the sta_info still exists in the remote AP after STA roam
  Causing the data forwarding incorrectly

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_a4_sta.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- After STA roam to repeater, the sta_info should be deleted in the remote AP
- when remote AP receive data from STA via repeater

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/12/02, wishchen, new feature

* DIGEST:
- Support 8814/8194 RFE type 0, 2, and 3 

* TEST METHOD:
- build MP to test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Update menuconfig to select RFE type

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_hw.c
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- 8192cd_osdep.c
- Hal88XXPhyCfg.c
- Kconfig

* DESCRIPTION:
- Update menuconfig for 8814/8194 to select RFE type.
  PA/LNA config will be automatically selected by RFE type option.
  Support RFE type 0, 2, and 3.
  0 -> internal PA/LNA, half mini card,
  2 -> external PA/LNA, PCIe card,
  3 -> external PA/LNA, on-board

  Root cause is that in update_sta_rssi, when rssimimo[0] = 0, cal_rssi_avg is not executed.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/11/19, lucy, bug fixed

* DIGEST:
- Fix A4_STA issue: ping fail after ethernet client roaming 

* TEST METHOD:
- (Client)---(Repeater)-----(AP)
     |                        |
     PC1                     PC2
  1. connect PC1 to (Clinet) using ethernet
  2. connect PC2 to (AP) using ethernet   
  3. ping PC1 to PC2
  4. switch PC1 and PC2 (PC1 connect to AP, and PC2 connect to Client)
  5. ping PC1 to PC2 againg, the ping should succeed
  
* ROOT CAUSE:
- The A4_STA database, bridge shortcut, and ethernet L2 cache should be updated after ethernet client roaming

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_cfg.h
- 8192cd_headers.h
- 8192cd_a4_sta.c
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- Kconfig
- Makefile


* DESCRIPTION:
-

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/11/14, Kai, Fixed DFS Tx stop bug

* DIGEST:
- Recovery DFS disable_tx if there is no need to do DFS

* TEST METHOD:
-

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Set unavailable channel in DFS band
  In 8192cd_open
  1. disable tx because channel in DFS band
  2. set channel to default(default channel could be not in DFS band) because channel is unavailable
  3. Not run DFS timer becuase channel is not in DFS band(but recovery disable_tx mechanism in DFS timer)
  Can not transmit tx forever because disable_tx=1

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_osdep.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DESCRIPTION:

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/11/13, jimmylin, new feature

* DIGEST:
- Add mib "txpwr_reduction" to reduce Tx power for one interface

* TEST METHOD:
- Use our client mode to connect to DUT
- Use "rssi 1" to monitor Tx power of DUT
- Use "setmib txpwr_reduction x" to change Tx power
- The RSSI should vary according to the mib value

* ROOT CAUSE:
-

* MODIFIED FILES:
- WlanHAL/RTL88XX/Hal88XXTxDesc.c
- 8192cd_sme.c
- ieee802_mib.h
- change.txt
- 8192cd_tx.c
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- 8192cd_proc.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- There are 4 levels:
  0: no reduction
  1:  -3 dB
  2:  -7 dB
  3: -11 dB
  other: no effect as 0
- This function applies to root, vxd, vap.
- Add for Netcore

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/11/06, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Enable Adaptivity for 8814/8194 and reduce aggregation num (0x4ca) to 0x1f for 8194.
  Modify EdcaTurboCheck mechanism for 8814.

* TEST METHOD:
- throughput test in sheilding room and 6F Field try.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 8194 AP mode v.s. 8194 Client TRX throughput issue (RA low throughput due to collision)
  Adaptivity (EDCCA) can improve this issue.

* MODIFIED FILES:
M    8192cd_ioctl.c
M    8192cd_hw.c
M    EdcaTurboCheck.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to enable Adaptivity for 8814/8194 and reduce aggregation num (0x4ca) to 0x1f for 8194.
  This patch is for 8194 AP mode v.s. 8194 Client TRX throughput issue (RA low throughput due to collision).
  Turn on Adaptivity (EDCCA) and reduce aggregation num (0x4ca) to 0x1f can improve throughput.

DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/31, hf_shi, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix WAPI group key not work when MBSSID enabled

* TEST METHOD:
-

* ROOT CAUSE:

- WAPI group using default key, if MBSSID enabled ,only one
- SSID can using HW crypto for group packets
- For WAPI multicast packet the UseSwCrypto return sw encrypt if vap_enable
- but group key in cam is true in software. so the packets is sent to air
  without
- encryption

* MODIFIED FILES:

- 8192cd_util.c
- wapi_wai.c
- 8192cd_osdep.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- if MBSSID enable, using swcryto for BCAST and Mcast packets
- refine UseSwCrypto functions
- move wapiInit code to the place after init_hw_PCI which reset all cam entry
- refine cam operation for WAPI

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/31, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- set Bit 26 (BIT_VHT_DACK) in REG_RCR for 8814 chip

* TEST METHOD:
- Connect by 8814AU in VHT mode and ping

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 8814AR receives AMPDU with one PDU and sends BA to 8814AU, but 8814AU cannot receive BA.
  In spec definition, station receiving AMPDU with one PDU should send ACK.

* MODIFIED FILES:

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to set Bit 26 (BIT_VHT_DACK) in REG_RCR for 8814 chip. This issue is triggered
  when 8814AR receives AMPDU with one PDU and sends BA to 8814AU, but 8814AU cannot receive BA.
  In spec definition, station receiving AMPDU with one PDU should send ACK.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/30, EricYeh, code refine

* DIGEST:
- patch: Client mode display "br0: received packet on eth0 with own address as source address"
  

* TEST METHOD:
- Use PC to connect DUT (Client mode) by ETH
- DUTenable "Enable Mac Clone" option 
  & connect to AP 
- Use PC to Ping AP 
- DUT apply change (from config webpage) 
    >> then console disaplay such error messages

* ROOT CAUSE:
- If enable Mac Clone, WiFi HW addr will clone mac to PC
- Flow of apply change:
    WiFi Down
    If Wifi enable "EFUSE", UI daemon will query HW addr from WiFi driver
     & Use this HW addr to bind Bridge
    But HW addr of WiFi driver is PC (by Mac Clone)
    Then, packets from PC, SA=WiFi's HW addr --> Show error messages

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_headers.h
- 8192cd_hw.c
- 8192cd_osdep.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Backup HW addr of WiFi from Efuse during close function

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/29, ray, bug fixed

* DIGEST:
- Fix HTC M7 bidirection throughput NG issue when LOW_TP_TXOP is defined.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/29, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fixed

* DIGEST:
- Fix wrong value of TX_DW4_DATA_RTY_LOWEST_RATE_MSK for 8814

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- The TX_DW4_DATA_RTY_LOWEST_RATE_MSK definition of 8814 is different from other chips.
  TX_DW4_DATA_RTY_LOWEST_RATE_MSK refers to rate in 8814. In other chips (ex. 8881a and 92e), this field is
  TX_DW4_DATA_RATEFB_LMT_MSK that means the times of fallback.

* MODIFIED FILES:
M    8192cd_tx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to fix wrong value of TX_DW4_DATA_RTY_LOWEST_RATE_MSK for 8814 chip. Root cause is
  that the TX_DW4_DATA_RTY_LOWEST_RATE_MSK definition of 8814 is different from other chips.
  TX_DW4_DATA_RTY_LOWEST_RATE_MSK refers to rate in 8814. In other chips (ex. 8881a and 92e), this field is
  TX_DW4_DATA_RATEFB_LMT_MSK that means the times of fallback.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/28, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Add Watchdog_kick when calling iwpriv reg_dump all

* TEST METHOD:
- Enter "iwpriv wlan0 reg_dump all"

* ROOT CAUSE:
- system reboot when calling "iwpriv wlan0 reg_dump all" in 8814/8194 chips.
  Root cause is watchdog timeout.

* MODIFIED FILES:
M    8192cd_ioctl.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to avoid system reboot when calling "iwpriv wlan0 reg_dump all" in 8814/8194 chips.
  Root cause is watchdog timeout when reg_dump all. So add watchdog_kick between dumping MAC Registers and RF Registers.

- 8814 MP B-Cut HW supports to detect HT hang and recover. So HT hang issue is fixed by HW.
  So this debug message is unnecessary.

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to disable HT hang reset message for 8814 MP B-Cut. 8814 MP B-Cut HW supports
  to detect HT hang and recover. So HT hang issue is fixed by HW. So this debug message is unnecessary.

- 2014/10/28, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 8194 2G pure B mode core dump issue

* TEST METHOD:
- Turn on 98C+8814+8194 in open space and set 8194 as B mode.
  It will be core dump when calling fill_probe_rsp_content function.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Previous patch for 8194 AC mode to modify get_bssrate_set function but it causes core dump when B mode is used.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_util.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to fix 8194 2G pure B mode core dump issue. Root cause is that previous patch for 8194 AC (256QAM) mode
  to modify  get_bssrate_set function but it causes core dump when B mode is used.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/27, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Disable 8814 ODM_BB_DYNAMIC_TXPWR function

* TEST METHOD:
- Field throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- In Field test, tx throughput at some points is lower than competition AP (ex. R7000).
  This is because R7000 uses high PA (8db larger than 8194/8814). BB recommends to disable Dynamic
  TXPWR function.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to disable 8814 ODM_BB_DYNAMIC_TXPWR function. In Field test, tx throughput
  at some points is lower than competition AP (ex. R7000). This is because R7000 uses high PA
  (8db larger than 8194/8814). BB recommends to disable Dynamic TXPWR function.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/27, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Modify 8814/8194 0x4ca (agg num) to 0x3c3c.

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- For 8814 Firmware v7, throughput is unstable when 0x4ca=0x3c3c. Root cause is firmware RA counter
  may be overflow so that RA chooses wrong tx rate.
  For 8814 Firmware v8, 8814 0x4ca can be set to 0x3c3c.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to modify 8814 0x4ca (agg num) to 0x3c3c. For 8814 Firmware v7, throughput is unstable when 0x4ca=0x3c3c.
  Root cause is firmware RA counter may be overflow so that RA chooses wrong tx rate.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/23, lucy, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix A4_STA connectivity issue after DHCP renew

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- When the topology is: AP(DHCP Server) ----Repeater1----- Repeater2
  The arp packet that Repeater2's VXD interface sends after recieving DHCP response 
  will cause Repeater1's A4_STA database incorrect. 
  It is no need to sent arp packet when using A4_STA connection

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_rx.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/23, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- set manual_ampdu to 0 as default

* TEST METHOD:

* ROOT CAUSE:

* MODIFIED FILES:
M    8192cd_ioctl.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to set manual_ampdu to 0 as default. 
  manual_ampdu = 0 means that ampdu num is dependent on min(AMPDU_NUM in TXDESC, 0x4ca).
  manual_ampdu = 1 means that ampdu num is dependent on 0x4ca.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/23, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Update 8814 Firmware v7 

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:

* MODIFIED FILES:
M    WlanHAL/Data/8814A/rtl8814AfwMP.bin

* DESCRIPTION:
- Firmware v7 updates the following items
  - update RA to v1.05
    ver 1.03
    1. fixed N_HIGH, N_LOW for 3SS, 2SS
    2. Change Rate priority for HT mode
    3. Modify SGI_enhance

    ver 1.04
    1. extend counter by u32
    2. Add Nsc limit in Highest rate
    3. modify HT rate penalty for 2G ChD

    ver 1.05
    1. modify HT mode penalty
    2. add penalty control from driver H2C
    3. modify VHT try ness

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/23, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Set 8814 Aggregation Num (0x4ca) to 0x20 to avoid RA unstable issues.

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Unknown, BB members are checking this issue.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_hw.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to set 8814 aggregation Num (0x4ca) to 0x20 to avoid RA unstable issues. When 0x4ca is 0x3c,
  RA cannot be up to high rate (3SS MCS7). When set 0x4ca to 0x20, RA mechanism could be stable.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/21, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 8814 beacon_err counter issue when TX_PAUSE is enabled.

* TEST METHOD:
- Set TX_PAUSE (0x522) to 0xff

* ROOT CAUSE:
- When bcn_err flag is set, wrong counter is used.

* MODIFIED FILES:
M    8192cd_osdep.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to fix 8814 beacon_err = 0 issue when TX_PAUSE is enabled. Root cause is that
  when bcn_err flag is set, wrong counter (beacon_ok) is accumlated.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/17, Brian, bug fix
* DIGEST:
- VAP not beacon after hang up reset or "the last vap" down up
* TEST METHOD:
- Initiate only one vap, down up va0 through console.
  Then root interface's vap_enable is 0 instead of 1.
* ROOT CAUSE:
* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_osdep.c
* DESCRIPTION:
- While turnkey platform, value of vap_enable is set during initial script.
  But for OpenWRT platform, value of vap_enable is decided within wireless
  driver. So, vap_enable should be kept at turnkey platform.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/13, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Adjust Aggregation Number based on HT ie and VHT ie

* TEST METHOD:
- Connection and check aggregation number in Proc. Aggregation number in N mode is based on HT Cap ie.
  Aggregation number in AC mode is based on VHT Cap ie.


* ROOT CAUSE:
- Aggregation number affects maximum throughput

* MODIFIED FILES:
M    8192cd_rx.c
M    8192cd_proc.c
M    8192cd.h
M    8192cd_tx.c
M    8192cd_sme.c
M    8192cd_ioctl.c
M    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/Hal88XXTxDesc.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to adjust aggregation number based on HT ie and VHT ie. Aggregation umber may affect maximum throughput.
  Aggregation number in N mode is based on HT Cap ie.
  Aggregation number in AC mode is based on VHT Cap ie.
  Add a mib "manual_ampdu" to adjust 0x4ca for debuging.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/10/02, wishchen, new feature

* DIGEST:
- Support MP hardware Tx for 8814

* TEST METHOD:
- MP tool and RF IQ verification

* ROOT CAUSE:
- n/a

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_mp.c
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- 8192cd_headers.h
- 8192cd_util.h

* DESCRIPTION:
- Support 8814 MP hardware Tx by adding a new ioctl: mp_pmac_ctx, 
  which calls function mp_pmac_tx, the pseudo MAC Tx.
  mp_pmac_tx uses parameter consist of struct _RT_PMAC_TX_INFO needing 
  MP tool to fill out the structure.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/09/29, button, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Fine tune wlan forwarding throughput

* TEST METHOD:
- Run chariot form 2.4G STA to 5G STA,
  and 5G STA to 2.4G STA

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/09/23, wishchen, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Prolong RF query delay time to 30us

* TEST METHOD:
- Netcore MP test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Some boards need longer RF query delay time; otherwise the queried 
  RF values may be wrong.
- When Netcore's 8881A switch channel in MP Rx test, the IQK may query 
  the wrong RF value and resulted in wrong 0x18 register value

* MODIFIED FILES:
- Hal88XXPhyCfg.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- Prolong RF query delay from 10us to 30us. Corresongding RF member Arthur and 
  BB member James.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/09/18, wishchen, new feature

* DIGEST:
- Support 8881A high power

* TEST METHOD:
- RF test 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- n/a

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd.h
- 8192cd_proc.c
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- Hal88XXPhyCfg.c
- HalCfg.h
 
* DESCRIPTION:

  depends on "External PA". 8881A HP uses "External PA" PHY but sets
  0xcb0(TRSW control pin) 0x54. 
  Demoboard doesn't have this type. It's just for Accton now.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/09/16, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Fix security throughput issue (only 600Mbps) for 8814

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- modify ampdu density and AMPDU length in HT IE.

* MODIFIED FILES:
-    8192cd_tx.c
-    8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to fix security throughput issue (only 600Mbps) for 8814. Root cause is when security mode, ampdu density is 16us 
  and ampdu length is 32K only. Modify ampdu density from 16us to 4us and ampdu length from 32K to 64K.
  This setting is referred to Broadcom AP R7000 HT IE setting.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/09/16, Jeng-Wei LEE, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Modify RF Registers access function for 8814

* TEST METHOD:
- irf 0 18 to check if the value is fixed when no channel switch happens.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- For 8814, I/O RF registers access method may obtain wrong values. So use
  direct access to obtain the values of RF registers.

* MODIFIED FILES:
-    8192cd_headers.h
-    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/RTL8814A/RTL8814AE/Hal8814AEGen.c
-    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/RTL8814A/Hal8814APhyCfg.c
-    WlanHAL/RTL88XX/RTL8814A/Hal8814APhyCfg.h

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to modify RF Registers access function for 8814. Root cause is that
  For 8814, I/O RF registers access method may obtain wrong values. So use
  direct access to obtain the values of RF registers.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/09/15, scko, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Fixed 8812 RX hang issue when doing endurance test of connect/disconnect.

* TEST METHOD:
- Use ConnectDisconnect script to test and ping AP.

* ROOT CAUSE:
- The RF MIMO switch mechanism will switch to 1T1R when no STA connects. After a STA connects, it switches to 2T2R. However, the RF switch repeatly will cause 8812 to hang. This might be a IC issue. The workaround is closing the CCK/OFDM BB block before the switch and re-enable it after the switch is completed.

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_headers.h
- 8192cd_hw.c
- 8192cd_ioctl.c
- 8192cd_util.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:

* DIGEST:
- patch: 88E client mode ping fail (After target AP apply change)

* TEST METHOD:
- 1. 88E client mode connect to AP1 & Ping 
  2. AP1 apply change 
  3. 88E can NOT ping AP1

* ROOT CAUSE:

  But Not recover to Link status after receiving AssocRsp.

* DESCRIPTION:

  call update_remapAid() before doing RTL8188E_MACID_NOLINK for 88E.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/08/29, Jeng-Wei LEE, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 8814 repeater mode low throughput issue

* TEST METHOD:
- Chariot throughput test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- In clnt_switch_chan_to_bss, miss (GET_CHIP_VER(priv)==VERSION_8814A) so that wrong Bandwidth 40MHZ is selected.

* MODIFIED FILE
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to fix 8814 repeater mode low throughput issue. This is because in clnt_switch_chan_to_bss function, 
   miss (GET_CHIP_VER(priv)==VERSION_8814A) condition  so that wrong Bandwidth 40MHz is selected.

* DIGEST:
- Support 8814 MP Tx/Rx antenna path of BC, CD, BCD, and ABCD 

* TEST METHOD:
- registers checked

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Change A,B,C,D to aux,1,2,3 and the combinations are changed

- 8192cd.h
- 8192cd_mp.c

* DESCRIPTION:

  Path A has polling problem, so change A to aux, and B to 1 to be the first
  antenna.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/08/21, Andrew,  bug fix

* DIGEST:
- TKIP encryption leads to mic error with Apple AP

* TEST METHOD:
- 

* ROOT CAUSE:
- During rekey procedure, Apple AP will brocast different key id packets, but driver only has 
  the latest key id. It will lead to MIC compute error.

* MODIFIED FILES:
-  8192cd.h
-  8192cd_aes.c
-  8192cd_cfg.h
-  8192cd_proc.c
-  8192cd_security.c
-  8192cd_tkip.c

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/08/21, wishchen, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix MP Tx idle bug in corner case

* TEST METHOD:
- RF team MP Tx test pass

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Rx path registers 0x808 should be set the same path as Tx when doing Tx test

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_mp.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- When doing MP Tx, Rx path registers 0x800 should be set as the path of Tx.
  If 0x808 is not correctly set, Tx power has skirt effect.
  Bug detected by WNC and verified by RF Brian.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------


* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/08/20, wishchen, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Fix 88E TRx antenna diversity init settings: 0x914

* TEST METHOD:
- RF test main and aux Tx

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 88E TRx antenna diversity initial setting is not correct

* MODIFIED FILES:
- OUTSRC/odm_AntDiv.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 88E TRx antenna diversity initial setting is not correct so that one path
  has no Tx power. 0x914[7:0]=0x1, while 0x914[15:8] should be 0x2

* DESCRIPTION:

  NHM energy is saperate into 10 levels and it increases the possibility of selecting the right channel.

-------------------------------------------------------------     
* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/08/01, brian, feature refine

* DIGEST:
- Unsynced channel number between root interface and vxd interface cause
  vxd disconnected after site-survey, triggered through root interface,
finished

* TEST METHOD:
1. Setup repeater and connect to an AP
2. iwpriv wlan0 set_mib func_off=1 to make root AP being function off
3. Change the connected AP to another channel then make vxd reconnect
4. After vxd is connected again, site-survey through WEB GUI then
   monitor vxd connectivity through cat /proc/wlan0-vxd/sta_info | link
5. Result of step 4 is link_time will be reset

* ROOT CAUSE:
- vxd disconnected because channel is switched to root interface after
  site-survey finished. When vxd try to reconnect AP, vxd's channel will sync
to
  the new channel. Root's channel should be synced by clnt_switch_chan_to_bss
  but ignored because of func_off. So, when swich channel to root's channel
  after sitesurvey finished, vxd will disconnect to AP.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_sme.c

* DESCRIPTION:
-

-------------------------------------------------------------

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/08/01, Jeng-Wei LEE, fix bug

* DIGEST:
- Correct VHT IE to support 3SS VHT rates for 8814 MP chips

* TEST METHOD:
- sniffer and check beacon VHT ie

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 8814 MP chips mimo type is 4T4R and causes wrong  VHT IE.

* MODIFIED FILES:
-    8192cd_ioctl.c
-    8812_vht_gen.c
-    8192cd_util.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- This patch is to correct VHT IE to support 3SS VHT rates for 8814 MP chips.
  This is because 8814 MP chips mimo type is changed from 3T3R to 4T4R and causes wrong VHT IE.

-------------------------------------------------------------


* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/08/01, wishchen, fix bug

* DIGEST:
- Remove modified ODM code about power tracking for 8814

* TEST METHOD:
- compile pass

* ROOT CAUSE:
- ODM has alread created new power tracking function for 8814, old power
  tracking should be removed

* MODIFIED FILES:
- OUTSRC/HalPhyRf.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- In branch v3.4.8, power tracking for 8814 is the same function with 8812, but in
  branch v3.4 BB created new function for 8814, so the modifictaion to the
  8812 function should be removed.

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/07/30, wishchen, fix bug

* DIGEST:
- 1. Fix 8814 mp set datarate bug. 2. Remove 8814 ODM TxAGC MACRO. 3. Update
  8814 0x82c BB registers for diff. BW

* TEST METHOD:
- Check mp data rate settings and registers

* ROOT CAUSE:
- 8814 has 3SS rate, needs new data rate coding from MP tool

* MODIFIED FILES:
- 8192cd_mp.c
- odm_reg.h
- Hal88XXPhyCfg.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- 1. 8814 MP use mp_version to tell MP tool to use new rate coding, so that mp
  driver needs not to translate MP tool old rate to new rate(but other ICs
  need).

* DIGEST:
- For 8812, read and set bb swing setting from efuse if EN_EFUSE is defined

* ROOT CAUSE:

* DATE/WHOM/TYPE:
- 2014/07/14 , wishchen, bug fix

* DIGEST:
- Since v3.4.7, VHT rate base number changed from 0x90 to 0xA0.
  MP tool uses old VHT rate base number, translation is needed.

* TEST METHOD:
- MP tool Tx test

* ROOT CAUSE:
- Only 98C do the translation, but other ICs need translation too.

* MODIFIED FILES
- 8192cd_mp.c

* DESCRIPTION:
- VHT rate base number changed from 0x90 to 0xA0 due to 3SS rate 
  support.
  Considering compatibility of old MP tool, translation from old 
  VHT rate base to new base is needed in mp driver when setting 
  Tx rate.
